page.title: 14Bright Steels (continued)
page.content:
Bright steel from Norton-on-Derwent, steel that has been cleaned, brightened, and drawn through dies to achieve the desired shape, was used in the building of the two famous "Queen" liners - the Queen Mary and the Queen Elizabeth.
Bright Steels is firm that prides itself on its human approach to industry. The company is concerned with the welfare of its employees and this has been reciprocated by loyalty to the firm which can go back several generations. Fathers, mothers, sons and daughters are employed on the works and administration side of the business. There are in fact seven of the current staff of one hundred and sixty who have forty or more years of service while seven other staff claim more than twenty five years service.
